title: Static Analysis

android.permission.BLUETOOTH.description: Allows an application to view configuration of the local Bluetooth phone and to make and accept connections with paired devices.

android.permission.BLUETOOTH_ADMIN.description: Allows an application to configure the local Bluetooth phone and to discover and pair with remote devices.

android.permission.WRITE_EXTERNAL_STORAG.description: Allows an application to write to the SD card.

android.permission.CAMERA.description: Allows application to take pictures and videos with the camera. This allows the application to collect images that the camera is seeing at any time.

android.permission.RECORD_AUDIO.description: Allows application to access the audio record path.

android.permission.ACCESS_FINE_LOCATION.description: Access fine location sources, such as the Global Positioning System on the phone, where available. Malicious applications can use this to determine where you are and may consume additional battery power.

manifest_analysis.title:
Application Data can be Backed up
[android:allowBackup=true]
manifest_analysis.desc: This flag allows anyone to backup your application data via adb. It allows users who have enabled USB debugging to copy application data off of the device.
manifest_analysis.name: Application Data can be Backed up [android:allowBackup=true]

strings:
"auto_stabilise_info" : "Auto-level will automatically rotate photos so that they appear level.

Note that this means images will come out a slightly lower resolution (due to the rotation and cropping that's required)."

"auto_stabilise_not_supported" : "Sorry, auto-level not supported
on this device"

"hdr_info" : "HDR mode is useful for shots with a large variation in brightness. It works by taking multiple shots at different exposures, and combining them to create the final image.

Note that HDR is not suitable for scenes with fast movement, and may result in less accurate color reproduction.

Taking photos in HDR mode will be slower."

"intro_text" : "Touch to focus, and press the blue camera button to take photos. 

To disable maximum screen brightness, see Settings/On screen GUI/"Force maximum brightness". To save to SD cards on Android 5+, see Settings/More camera controls/"Use Storage Access Framework". For more help, click "Online help" from Settings."

"magnetic_accuracy_info" : "Your device's compass needs calibrating to improve its accuracy. This can be done by moving your device in a figure of 8 motion.

Current accuracy:"
"open_files_saf_exception_generic" : "No file dialog found on this device, option is not supported"
"open_files_saf_exception_ghost" : "No file dialog found on this device, ghost image option is not supported"

"panorama_info" : "To take a panorama image, hold your device in portrait orientation, and click to take a photo to start the panorama. Then rotate your device either left or right to move the centred white circle over the blue dot. After each new image is captured, keep rotating your device to cover each new blue dot that appears in turn.

Click the tick icon to save the panorama, or the cross icon to cancel.

Note that panorama photos can take time to process and save."
"permission_rationale_camera" : "Camera permission is required to enable the camera"

"permission_rationale_location" : "Location permission is required for geotagging (storing location data in photos and videos). Location permission is also required for connecting to Bluetooth LE remote control devices."
"permission_rationale_record_audio" : "Microphone permission is required to record video with audio, as well as use the "Audio control" options"
"permission_rationale_storage" : "Storage read/write permission is required to save photos"
"preference_angle_highlight_color_summary" : "Highlight color for when camera is nearly level"

"preference_audio_control_summary" : "Take photo/video when a noise is detected, or on voice command. When enabled, use the on-screen microphone button to start/stop listening. Note the voice command option uses the Android speech recognition service: when using this option, audio data is likely to be sent to remote servers to perform speech recognition. 
%s"
"preference_audio_noise_control_sensitivity_summary" : "Noise level sensitivity for audio (loud noise) option"
"preference_auto_stabilise_summary" : "Images will be rotated so they are automatically level (photos only) (slower to take photos, and may fail on devices with too low memory)"
"preference_background_photo_saving_summary" : "Whether to save photos on a background thread (for faster operation)"

"preference_calibrate_level_dialog" : "Please place your device on a flat horizontal surface so that it is level (either in portrait or landscape orientation), and then select Calibrate.

Press Reset to remove the calibration from your device.

Press back button to cancel."
"preference_calibrate_level_summary" : "This option calibrates your device's accelerometer, so the auto-level and on-screen level/angle options work correctly"
"preference_camera2_fake_flash_summary" : "Enable this if your device has buggy flash behaviour with Camera2 API"
"preference_camera2_fast_burst_summary" : "Allows faster capture of the HDR/expo shots. Disable this if your device has problems when taking photos with HDR or Expo photo modes."
"preference_camera2_photo_video_recording_summary" : "Allows taking photos whilst recording videos. Disable this if there are problems with video recording with Camera2 API enabled on your device."

"preference_camera_api_summary" : "Select Camera2 API to enables extra feature such as manual modes for exposure, focus, white balance, along with RAW (if supported by the device), but may not work properly on all devices. Changing the API will cause a restart.
%s"
"preference_color_effect_summary" : "Applies the selected color effect to the photo"

"preference_crop_guide_summary" : "A crop guide displays a rectangle showing what the specified aspect ratio looks like - useful if you plan to crop the photo/video afterwards to a different aspect ratio. Requires WYSIWYG photo mode, or being in video mode.
%s"

"preference_donate_summary" : "If you like this app, please consider making a donation to support development. You can do this by purchasing my donation app - click this option to open up the page for my donation app. Thanks!"

"preference_edge_mode_summary" : "Algorithm that the camera driver should use for applying edge enhancement. Edge enhancement improves sharpness and details in the captured image. (This setting is ignored in NR photo mode.)
%s"
"preference_exif_artist_summary" : "Text to store in the image metadata for the artist tag (JPEG format only). (Leave blank for none.)"
"preference_exif_copyright_summary" : "Text to store in the image metadata for the copyright tag (JPEG format only). (Leave blank for none.)"

"preference_expo_bracketing_n_images_summary" : "Number of images for exposure bracketing mode
%s"

"preference_expo_bracketing_stops_summary" : "How many stops to subtract/add for the darkest/brightest image
%s"
"preference_exposure_summary" : "Set to 0 for the default exposure compensation"
"preference_face_detection_summary" : "Use face detection instead of focus areas"

"preference_focus_assist_summary" : "Whether to zoom in when adjusting manual focus distance
%s"

"preference_focus_peaking_color_summary" : "Which color to use for highlighting the in-focus edges
%s"

"preference_focus_peaking_summary" : "If this option is enabled, highlights will be shown on in-focus edges (contours). This is primarily useful for manual focus, and can be used to help determine which regions of the image are in focus.
%s"
"preference_force_video_4k" : "Force 4K UHD video (only works on some devices)"

"preference_force_video_4k_summary" : "Enable 3840x2160 resolution for video recording on back camera - this option is a hack that may allow 4K devices on 4K cameras that don't expose the option to 3rd party camera apps. This isn't guaranteed to work, please test before working."
"preference_free_memory_summary" : "Display the remaining device storage space on screen"

"preference_front_camera_mirror_summary" : "Whether to mirror the resultant photos when using the front camera
%s"

"preference_ghost_image_summary" : "Overlay an image, to help with alignment.
%s"
"preference_gps_direction_summary" : "Store GPS compass direction in the photos (JPEG format only)"

"preference_hdr_contrast_enhancement_summary" : "When to use a contrast enhancement algorithm for HDR. This can improve the appearance in cases where there is a very high dynamic range in the scene, and also gives a HDR look to the results.
%s"

"preference_hdr_save_expo_summary" : "If enabled, when using HDR photo mode, the three base exposure images will be saved as well as the final HDR photo. Note this will make saving slower, especially if options like "Stamp photos" or Auto-level are also used."

"preference_histogram_summary" : "Whether to display histogram of the colors shown on-screen
%s"

"preference_image_format_summary" : "Select the file format used for saving photos. This affects "standard" (not RAW) photos. Note that PNG format is not truly lossless, instead it is converted from a JPEG at 100%% quality.
%s"
"preference_iso_summary" : "A higher value means more sensitive to light (may not work on some devices)"
"preference_keep_display_on_summary" : "If enabled, the screen won't switch off while the main Open Camera UI is active"

"preference_licence_google_icons_text" : "Open Camera uses icons from Google's Material Design icons (https://developer.android.com/design/downloads/index.html , https://design.google.com/icons/ , https://github.com/google/material-design-icons/ , https://google.github.io/material-design-icons/) under the Apache license version 2.0. Some icons include modifications. Tap here for full licence text."
"preference_licence_online_text" : "Please tap here for full online licensing information (opens in your browser)."
"preference_licence_open_camera_text" : "Open Camera is © 2013–2019 Mark Harman, released under the GPL v3 or later. Tap here for full licence text."
"preference_location_summary" : "Store GPS location data in the photos/videos (for photos, location data can only be stored in JPEG and DNG formats)"

"preference_lock_orientation_summary" : "If set, the orientation of the device will be ignored, and the orientation of the photo/video will be with respect to the specified orientation
%s"

"preference_lock_video_summary" : "When recording video, the GUI will be locked to prevent accidentally stopping recording. Swipe the screen to unlock. Note that video recording will always stop if the app goes into background or the screen is blanked."
"preference_max_brightness_summary" : "Force screen display to be at maximum brightness, rather than device default"

"preference_noise_reduction_mode_summary" : "Algorithm that the camera driver should use for applying noise reduction. The noise reduction algorithm attempts to improve image quality by removing excessive noise added by the capture process, especially in dark conditions. (Note that this is not related to the Noise Reduction photo mode, and in fact this setting is ignored in NR photo mode.)
%s"
"preference_nr_mode_low_light_message" : "Low light mode: please hold the camera steady"

"preference_nr_save_summary" : "Whether to save original images in noise reduction mode. Note this can make saving photos much slower.
%s"
"preference_online_help_summary" : "Launch the Open Camera website in your browser"

"preference_panorama_crop_summary" : "For panorama mode, whether to remove the wavy boundaries
%s"

"preference_panorama_save_summary" : "Whether to save original images in panorama mode. Note this will make saving panorama photos slower. Also allows the option to save an XML file which can be useful reporting problems with panorama.
%s"
"preference_pause_preview_summary" : "Pause the screen after taking a photo, with the option to share or delete the photo"

"preference_privacy_policy_text" : "Open Camera accesses camera sensor and microphone data to fulfil its purpose as a camera. Microphone is also used for the optional "Audio control". 
Access to files is needed to save resultant photos and videos to your device. 
Location permission is required for the optional geotagging/stamp/subtitles and Bluetooth features. 
Since Open Camera also uses operating system APIs, you should review relevant privacy policies such as for your device, manufacturer, operating system and/or Google accounts. For example: 
*The optional voice control option uses the Android speech recognition service. When enabled, audio data is likely to be sent to remote servers by Android to perform speech recognition. 
*The "addresses" option for photo stamp or video subtitles uses the Android Geocoder API. When enabled, this requires that your device transmits location data across the Internet to a third party (which may depend on what backend services are installed on your device). 
*Apps/services such as cloud services on your device may auto-upload photos and videos that are saved on your device."

"preference_quality_summary" : "Set the image quality of saved JPEG or WebP photo images (default value is 90%%). Has no effect for PNG image format.
%s"

"preference_raw_expo_bracketing_summary" : "Whether the RAW option should also apply for expo bracketing photo mode (or for HDR mode when "Save all images for HDR mode" is enabled). If this option is disabled, only JPEGs will be saved in those photo modes."

"preference_raw_focus_bracketing_summary" : "Whether the RAW option should also apply for focus bracketing photo mode. If this option is disabled, only JPEGs will be saved in focus bracketing photo modes."
"preference_record_audio_channels_summary" : "Specify mono or stereo for recording audio (stereo only supported on some devices)"
"preference_remote_disconnect_screen_dim_summary" : "Hint: set default brightness to minimum level before starting Open Camera."
"preference_require_location_summary" : "If location data is enabled, only take photo/video if location data is available"
"preference_reset_question" : "Are you sure you want to reset all Open Camera settings to default?"
"preference_reset_summary" : "Reset all Open Camera settings to default"

"preference_restore_settings_question" : "This option allows you to select one of the settings files that you previously saved. Be warned that selecting a file to load will overwrite all current settings!"
"preference_restore_settings_summary" : "Restores previously saved settings. This will overwrite all current settings with the saved settings!"

"preference_rotate_preview_summary" : "Option to rotate the preview (won't affect resultant photos/videos)
%s"
"preference_save_location_summary" : "Folder to save the photo/video files in"
"preference_save_photo_prefix_summary" : "The prefix to use for the save filenames for photos"
"preference_save_settings_summary" : "Saves all of Open Camera's settings to a file"
"preference_save_video_prefix_summary" : "The prefix to use for the save filenames for videos"
"preference_show_angle_summary" : "Display the current device orientation angle on screen"

"preference_show_auto_level_summary" : "Whether to show an on-screen icon for enabling or disabling auto-level. When auto-level is enabled, photos will be rotated so they are automatically level with the horizon."
"preference_show_battery_summary" : "Display the current battery level on screen"
"preference_show_cycle_flash_summary" : "Whether to show an on-screen icon for cycling through the flash options, instead of displaying flash options on the popup menu"
"preference_show_cycle_raw_summary" : "Whether to show an on-screen icon for cycling through the RAW modes"
"preference_show_exposure_lock_summary" : "Whether to show an on-screen icon for locking or unlocking exposure"
"preference_show_face_detection_summary" : "Whether to show an on-screen icon for enabling or disabling face detection"
"preference_show_geo_direction_summary" : "Display the compass direction of the device on screen"
"preference_show_iso_summary" : "Display the current ISO level. In flash auto mode, a flash symbol will also indicate when flash will fire. (Requires Camera2 API.)"
"preference_show_stamp_summary" : "Whether to show an on-screen icon for enabling or disabling photo stamp"
"preference_show_store_location_summary" : "Whether to show an on-screen icon for enabling or disabling location data (geotagging)"

"preference_show_take_photo_summary" : "Show the icon for taking photos and recording videos. Uncheck if you'd rather take photos by other methods (e.g., if your device has a hardware shutter button, or using the volume keys)."
"preference_show_textstamp_summary" : "Whether to show an on-screen icon for specifying custom text to be stamped onto the photo"
"preference_show_video_max_amp_summary" : "Whether to show on-screen audio level when recording video"
"preference_show_whats_new_summary" : "Whether to display information on new features and improvements when the application has updated"
"preference_show_when_locked_summary" : "If enabled, Open Camera will still show above any lockscreen (you'll still have to unlock to access Settings, Gallery etc)"
"preference_show_white_balance_lock_summary" : "Whether to show an on-screen icon for locking or unlocking auto white balance"
"preference_show_zoom_summary" : "Display the current camera zoom level on screen (when zoomed in)"
"preference_shutter_sound_summary" : "Play a sound when taking a photo"
"preference_stamp_font_color_summary" : "Font color to use when stamping text onto photos"
"preference_stamp_fontsize_summary" : "Font size to use when stamping text onto photos"
"preference_stamp_geo_address_both" : "Display address if possible, in addition to GPS coords"

"preference_stamp_geo_address_summary" : "If possible, use an address when stamping GPS locations. This option requires an Internet connection. Note that if enabled, this requires that your device transmits location data across the Internet to a third party in order to convert GPS coordinates to an address. See https://developer.android.com/reference/android/location/Geocoder . 
%s"

"preference_stamp_style_summary" : "Style to use when stamping text onto photos
%s"

"preference_stamp_summary" : "Stamp photos with date and time; and also GPS info if location/direction data is enabled
%s"
"preference_startup_focus_summary" : "Whether to auto-focus when Open Camera is started. If you have the problem of flash turning on when starting, disable this option"
"preference_take_photo_border_summary" : "Display a border on the display to indicate taking a photo"
"preference_thumbnail_animation_summary" : "Display moving thumbnail animation when taking a photo"
"preference_timer_beep_summary" : "Beep when timer is counting down or for repeat mode delay"
"preference_timer_speak_summary" : "Speak the countdown for timer or repeat mode delay (from 60 seconds)"
"preference_touch_capture_summary" : "Take a photo just by touching or double-tapping the preview"

"preference_units_distance_summary" : "Used for GPS altitude for photo stamp and video subtitles
%s"

"preference_use_camera2_summary" : "Enables extra features such as manual modes for exposure, focus, white balance, along with RAW (if supported by the device), but may not work properly on all devices (will cause a restart)"
"preference_using_saf_summary" : "Whether to use Storage Access Framework for saving photos and videos. This should be enabled (on Android 5+) to allow saving to external SD cards."

"preference_video_bitrate_summary" : "Set the approximate bitrate of videos (higher means better quality, but takes up more disk space; may cause video recording to fail if bitrate not supported)
%s"
"preference_video_flash_summary" : "If enabled, flash will switch on/off when recording video (can be used to tell camera is still recording at a distance)"

"preference_video_fps_summary" : "Set the frame rate (FPS) of videos (may be approx, not guaranteed to be achieved, and may cause video recording to fail if frame rate not supported). Note that this setting is ignored for slow motion videos.
%s"

"preference_video_log_summary" : "Enable a flat (log) profile for video mode
%s"

"preference_video_low_power_check_summary" : "Stop video recording if battery level is critically low. This helps reduce the risk of videos being corrupted if your device suddenly switches off due to running out of power."

"preference_video_max_duration_summary" : "The video recording will stop after the specified duration
%s"

"preference_video_max_filesize_summary" : "The video recording will stop and/or restart (see option below) when the (approximate) maximum file size is reached. Note that many Android devices have a maximum file size for videos (typically around 2GB or 4GB), but this option allows setting a specific value. Note that this option can't be used to increase a device's built-in maximum.
%s"

"preference_video_output_format_summary" : "Video and audio file format and codecs
%s"
"preference_video_restart_max_filesize_summary" : "Whether to automatically restart when the maximum file size is reached (whether the device default max file size, or user specified)"

"preference_video_restart_summary" : "If the video has stopped after hitting the maximum duration (if set), this option will make the video restart, up to the specified number of times
%s"
"preference_video_stabilization_summary" : "Video stabilization reduces the shaking due to the motion of the camera in both the preview and in recorded videos"

"preference_video_subtitle_summary" : "Create a subtitles (.SRT) file storing date and time; and also GPS info if location/direction data is enabled
%s"
"preference_water_type_summary" : "For underwater housings, improves accuracy if correct water type is selected."
"preference_white_balance_summary" : "Choose a setting to adjust the white balance"

"preference_zebra_stripes_summary" : "If this option is enabled, zebra stripes will be drawn on-screen showing where the camera preview is over exposed.
%s"

"raw_info" : "DNG files contain the full uncompressed and unprocessed information from your camera.

Note that some gallery apps don't recognise DNG files. DNG images can be used with specialised image editors like Snapseed or Lightroom.

Note that various processing options such as Stamp photos and Auto-level will only apply to the non-DNG (JPEG/etc) images, and not the DNG images."

"screen_is_locked" : "Screen is locked
swipe the screen to unlock"

"speech_recognizer_extra_info" : "(Your audio may be sent to remote
 servers by Android to perform speech
 recognition.)"
"video_no_free_space" : "Not enough free space to record video"

"whats_new_text" : " [This dialog is shown when Open Camera is updated. You can disable it under Settings/On screen GUI/Show What's New dialog.] 

v1.47.3:
  Camera2 API option is now a "list" selection rather than a toggle switch. This option should be copied over, but just in case, if you had enabled Camera2 API and Camera2 features are no longer available, please check Settings/"Camera API".
 Grids were being drawing too faintly.
 Updated appearance of some icons.
  "

"preference_lock_orientation_summary" : "設定すると機械上の向きよりも設定された向きを優先して保存します

"preference_lock_video_summary" : "録画が停止しないように画面を固定します。固定は画面をスワイプすると解除されます。アプリをバックグラウンドに移すか画面を消灯しても録画は停止します。"

Pliki w formacie DNG zajmują dużo miejsca. Do przenoszenia lub kasowania ich można użyć menedżera plików.

"raw_info" : "Los archivos DNG contienen la información completa sin comprimir y sin procesar de su cámara.

La mayoría de las aplicaciones de la galería no reconocerán DNG, sino que se deben usar con aplicaciones especializadas como Snapseed o Lightroom.

Tenga en cuenta que varias opciones de procesamiento, como el estampado de las fotos y el nivel automático, solo se aplicarán a las imágenes JPEG, y no a las imágenes DNG

Los archivos DNG ocupan mucho espacio; una aplicación de explorador de archivos puede ser útil para transferirlos o eliminarlos.

Los archivos DNG solo se guardan en los modos de fotografía estándar o DRO (D-Range Optimise)."

"raw_info" : "I files DNG contengono le informazioni provenienti dalla camera in modalità non compressa e senza alcuna rielaborazione.

Molte app di galleria non sono in grado di riconoscere tale formato, che invece deve essere utilizzato con apps specifiche tipo Snapseed o Lightroom.

Si sottolinea infine le opzioni di elaborazione tipo -timbro foto e Auto-level si applicano unicamente alle immagini JPEG, e no al formato DNG.

I files DNG occupano parecchio spazio; un app di tipo file explorer potrebbe essere utile per il loro trasferimento/cancellazione.

I files DNG files vengono salvati solamente se creati in modalità Standard oppure DRO."

"raw_info" : "A DNG fájlok a kamera teljes, tömörítetlen és feldolgozatlan adatait tartalmazzák.

A legtöbb galéria alkalmazás nem ismeri a DNG formátumot, érdemes helyette specializált alkalmazást használni, mint például a Snapseed vagy a Lightroom.

Megjegyzendő, hogy az utófeldolgozó beállítások, mint a „Fotók feliratozása” és „Auto-stabilizálás” csak a JPEG képekre kerülnek rá, a DNG-re nem.

A DNG fájlok sokkal több helyet foglalnak; egy fájlkezelő alkalmazás hasznos lehet a másolásukhoz, törlésükhöz.

DNG fájlok csak Normál és DRO fotómódban mentődnek."

"preference_video_restart_summary" : "Αν το βίντεο έχει σταματήσει μετά την μέγιστη διάρκεια (αν έχει ρυθμιστεί), η επιλογή αυτή θα επανεκκινήση το βίντεο, μέχρι τον καθορισμένο αριθμό διάρκειας

"preference_video_subtitle_summary" : "Δημιουργία αρχείου υποτίτλων (.SRT) που αποθηκεύει την ημερομηνία και την ώρα, και, επίσης, πληροφορίες GPS και αν η θέση/κατεύθυνση δεδομένων είναι ενεργοποιημένη
%s"
"preference_white_balance_summary" : "Επιλέξτε μια ρύθμιση για να ρυθμίσετε την ισορροπία λευκού"

"raw_info" : "DNG αρχεία περιέχουν πλήρες ασυμπίεστα και μη επεξεργασμένα στοιχεία από την φωτογραφική μηχανή σας.

Οι περισσότερες εφαρμογές δεν't αναγνωρίζουν αρχείαDNG, αντίθετα θα πρέπει να χρησιμοποιείται εξειδικευμένες εφαρμογές, όπως το Snapseed η το Lightroom.

Σημειώστε ότι οι διάφορες επιλογές επεξεργασίας όπως η Σφραγίδα φωτογραφιών και Αυτόματο επίπεδο ισχύουν μόνο για εικόνες JPEG, και όχι DNG.

Τα DNG αρχεία καταλαμβάνουν πολύ χώρο, ένα αρχείο εξερευνητής μπορεί να είναι χρήσιμο για τη μεταφορά ή τη διαγραφή τους.

Τα DNG αρχεία αποθηκεύονται μόνο στο πρότυπο."

playstore_details.title: Open Camera
playstore_details.description:
Open Camera is a fully featured and completely free Camera app. Features:
* Option to auto-stabilize so your pictures are perfectly level no matter what (see example image).
* Expose your camera's functionality: support for scene modes, color effects, white balance, ISO, exposure compensation/lock, selfie with "screen flash", HD video and more.
* Handy remote controls: timer (with optional voice countdown), auto-repeat mode (with configurable delay).
* Option to take photo remotely by making a noise, or by voice command "cheese".
* Configurable volume keys and user interface.
* Upside-down preview option for use with attachable lenses.
* Overlay a choice of grids and crop guides.
* Optional GPS location tagging (geotagging) of photos and videos; for photos this includes compass direction (GPSImgDirection, GPSImgDirectionRef).
* Apply date and timestamp, location coordinates, and custom text to photos; store date/time and location as video subtitles (.SRT).
* Panorama, including for front camera.
* Support for HDR (with auto-alignment and ghost removal) and Exposure Bracketing.
* Support for Camera2 API: manual controls (with optional focus assist); burst mode; RAW (DNG) files; slow motion video.
* Noise reduction (including low light night mode) and Dynamic range optimisation modes for better quality photos.
* Options for on-screen histogram, zebra stripes, focus peaking.
* Focus bracketing mode.
* Completely free, and no ads in the app (I only run ads on the website). Open Source.

(Some features may not be available on all devices, as they may depend on hardware or camera features, the Android version, etc.)

Website: http://opencamera.org.uk/
Forums: https://sourceforge.net/p/opencamera/discussion/
Source: https://sourceforge.net/p/opencamera/code/

Note that it's not possible for me to test Open Camera on every Android device out there, so please test before using Open Camera to photo/video your wedding etc :)

App icon by Adam Lapinski. Open Camera also uses content under third party licences, see https://opencamera.org.uk/#licence
playstore_details.summary: Fully featured and completely free Open Source Camera app.
playstore_details.summaryHTML: Fully featured and completely free Open Source Camera app.

Camera2 API option is now a "list" selection rather than a toggle switch. This option should be copied over, but just in case, if you had enabled Camera2 API and Camera2 features are no longer available, please check Settings/"Camera API".

Grids were being drawing too faintly.

Updated some icons for newer more consistent material design look.

Minor accessibility improvements.

Moved licences from about to separate preference category.
